english.segment1: Though many a year as now passed. The lesson's the same, but the sentiments changed. The impression it made still does last for all.
english.segment2: Serving his country, Enlist! Do it now. His took up his arms, he would show. Such bravery as he took many a life, Of the people he would never know
english.segment3: Sing of me. Of all the men I've killed, I know that this will build me up.
english.segment4: Think of me. I know that I'll be brave. They all fell down that day.
english.segment5: Well after the war, people picked up their life. The damage was already done. While fatherless children slept under the door, And woke innocent to the sun.
english.segment6: Please why me?. I know they'd take it back, Why don't they take it back?
english.segment7: Comfort me. A child grows to fast, And now let him ask.
english.segment8: A small little child sits and waits for his dad, Hands clutching a brown telegram, Informs him his father won't be coming home. He gave up his life for his land.
english.segment9: Sing of me. And all the men I've killed. I know that this will build me up.
english.segment10: And think of me. I know that was brave. We all fell down that day.
